oai_dc:dc.dc:title: University of Nashville Medical Department Lecture Session
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A listing of speakers and lecture hours are given for a lecture session taking place at the University of Nashville Medical Department. Formerly Davidson Academy and Cumberland College, the University of Nashville was so named at the suggestion of its President, Philip Lindsley. Lindsley's son, John Berrien, was also Chancellor of the school. The University of Nashville, located in the Rutledge Hill area, closed its building in 1911 and was absorbed by George Peabody College. 5 x 7 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
